result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Balcom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Batterers Treatment at WCH.
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
++  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May Not have contact with Aisha M unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

records.addlTxt: For Cts 1 & 3 only - Dismissed and Read In.
Deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Baumgardner and Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions consecutive to 15CM532 and concurrent to 16CF215 & 16CM213; deft to pay $200 DNA surcharge.  No contact w/Aisha M.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 3 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 8/11/16 at 10am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Baumgardner.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court does not enter judgment on bond forfeiture.  Case is set for jury selection.  Court addresses speedy trial demand and tolls time limits and adjourns trial.  STC set for 6/30/16 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
for joinder; filed by ADA Carli McNeill.
Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Aisha M or her residence
947.01(1) - DC repeater  /  943.01(1) - Criminal damage to property repeter  /  943.14 - Criminal trespass repeater

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty C Baumgardner appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Issue of bond due to speedy trial demand request.  Atty Baumgardner requests to modify bond to a signature bond.  ADA McNeill does not object.  Court amends cash bond to $1,000 signature bond w/same conditions previously set.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Baumgardner.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  Deft makes speedy trial demand.  JSH 6/9/16 at 1:15pm and JS 6/27/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
DA requests Bail/Bond and FPT be rescheduled to ADA McNeills week.  Hearings rescheduled to 04-05-16 at 8:45am with the approval of Atty Johnson.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Aisha M or her residence

Not Guilty Plea previously entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 01:45 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 08:15 am.  $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).    jk

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty C Baumgardner appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $500 cash bond, stayed until 2/12/16 at noon.
